users module

users.create_user(stage)[source]

Create a new user in the DynamoDB table.

This function prompts the user for a username and password, encodes the password, and stores the user information in the DynamoDB table.

Parameters:

stage – The deployment stage (e.g., ‘dev’, ‘prod’).

users.encode_password(password, salt=None)[source]

Encode a password using PBKDF2-HMAC-SHA256.

This function generates a salt if one is not provided, and uses it to hash the password.

Parameters:

  • password – The password to encode.

  • salt – Optional. The salt to use for hashing. If not provided, a new salt is generated.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the hash algorithm, salt, number of rounds, and hashed password.

users.get_table_name(stage)[source]

Get the DynamoDB table name for a given stage.

This function reads the Chalice configuration file to get the table name based on the stage.

Parameters:

stage – The deployment stage (e.g., ‘dev’, ‘prod’).

Returns:

The DynamoDB table name.

users.list_users(stage)[source]

List all users in the DynamoDB table.

This function retrieves and prints all usernames from the DynamoDB table.

Parameters:

stage – The deployment stage (e.g., ‘dev’, ‘prod’).

users.main()[source]

Command-line interface for user management.

This function parses command-line arguments and calls the appropriate function based on the provided arguments.

users.test_password(stage)[source]

Test a user’s password.

This function prompts for a username and password, retrieves the stored password information from the DynamoDB table, and verifies the provided password against the stored hash.

Parameters:

stage – The deployment stage (e.g., ‘dev’, ‘prod’).
